content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management</origin> <pubdate>201106</pubdate> <title>Shellfish Harvest Prohibition Areas for 2011; shellfish11</title> <edition>2011</edition> <geoform>vector digital data</geoform> <othercit>Suggested bibliographic reference: RIGIS, 2011. RI Shellfish Harvest Prohibition Areas for 2011. Rhode Island Geographic Information System (RIGIS) Data Distribution System, URL: http://www.edc.uri.edu/rigis, Environmental Data Center, University of Rhode Island, Kingston, Rhode Island (last date accessed: 30 June 2011).</othercit> <onlink>http://www.edc.uri.edu/rigis</onlink> <lworkcit> <citeinfo> <origin>Rhode Island Geographic Information System (RIGIS)</origin> <pubdate>1993</pubdate> <title>Rhode Island Geographic Information System (RIGIS) Data Distribution System</title> <onlink>http://www.edc.uri.edu/rigis</onlink> </citeinfo> </lworkcit> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>Geospatial vector polygon data defining shellfishing prohibition areas, seasonal, and conditional shellfish closure areas, and areas open to legal shellfish harvesting in RI marine and estuarine waters in accordance with the provisions of: Title 20, Chapter 8.1 Of the General Laws of 1956, entitled "shellfish grounds", notice is hereby given that certain water areas in Rhode Island overlying shellfish grounds have been found to be in an unsatisfactory sanitary condition for the taking of shellfish for human consumption and are declared to be polluted areas. Persons taking shellfish from said waters will be prosecuted in accordance with the provisions of the aforementioned chapter.</abstract> <purpose>Data were created for the production of maps to accompany the annual publication "Notice of Polluted Shellfishing Grounds" promulgated in May of each year. No determination of suitability has been made for any other use.</purpose> <supplinf>Complete information on Shellfish Closures, including maps is available on the RI Department of Environmental Management website at: http://www.dem.ri.gov/maps/mapfile/shellfsh.pdf</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>201105</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>publication date</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>Annually</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-71.911522</westbc> <eastbc>-71.092967</eastbc> <northbc>41.876462</northbc> <southbc>41.095328</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt> <themekey>environment</themekey> </theme> <theme> <themekt>None</themekt> <themekey>Issues</themekey> <themekey>Environment</themekey> <themekey>Fishery</themekey> <themekey>Shellfish</themekey> <themekey>Health</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>None</placekt> <placekey>Coastal</placekey> <placekey>New England</placekey> <placekey>Rhode Island</placekey> <placekey>Narragansett Bay</placekey> <placekey>Block Island</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>Restriction Code: other restrictions; Other Constraints: Access constraints: These copyrighted data are distributed under the terms of the RIGIS license agreement. License terms include (1) restrictions on secondary distribution of these data, and (2) graphic displays and printed tabular listings derived from RIGIS data may be used in publications and presentations, provided that credit is given to RIGIS as the source of the information or that notice of copyright [e.g. (c) 2006 RIGIS] be shown. Please review the RIGIS license agreement at http://www.edc.uri.edu/rigis/license.html for more information before accessing these data.</accconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>RI Department of Environmental Management</cntorg> <cntper>Paul Jordan</cntper> </cntorgp> <cntpos>Supervising GIS Specialist</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Unknown</addrtype> <address>235 Promenade Street</address> <city>Providence</city> <state>RI</state> <postal>02879</postal> <country>US</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>401-222-2776 x4315</cntvoice> <cntfax>401-222-2069</cntfax> <cntemail>pjordan@dem.state.ri.us</cntemail> <hours>8am to 4 pm</hours> <cntinst>e-mail is preferred</cntinst> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <datacred>RI DEM Geographic Information System</datacred> <native>Microsoft Windows Server 2008 R2 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.2.3200</native> </idinfo> <dataqual> <attracc> <attraccr>all shellfish closure polygons have been validated against the RIDEM Publication "Notice of Polluted Shellfishing Grounds"</attraccr> <qattracc> <attraccv>none</attraccv> <attracce>none</attracce> </qattracc> </attracc> <logic>none</logic> <complete>all restricted or potentially restricted shellfish harvest areas described in the regulations are included in this dataset</complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar>Testing has not been performed to determine a measure of positional accuracy. All shoreline features are coincident with the RIGIS 1:5000 (ritown5k). Data are assumed to be compliant National Map Accuracy standards for that scale (~14 feet), but has not been confirmed by testing. Closure area boundaries are based on a variety of sources for location of signs indicating polluted waters, landmarks and easily identifiable features such as points and headlands. GIS data for creation of these closure boundaries relied on both differential and non-differential GPS techniques and heads-up digitizing using 1:5000 RIGIS orthophotos as background.</horizpar> <qhorizpa> <horizpae>none</horizpae> </qhorizpa> </horizpa> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srccite> <citeinfo> <origin>RI Department of Transportation</origin> <pubdate>20010701</pubdate> <title>State of RI, state, city and shoreline boundaries</title> <geoform>map</geoform> </citeinfo> </srccite> <typesrc>None</typesrc> <srccitea>State of RI, state, city and shoreline boundaries</srccitea> <srccontr>1:5000 delineation of RI coastline</srccontr> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>Data contributed to RIGIS by the Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management. harvest area</udom> </attrdomv> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>SFC</attrlabl> <attrdef>Text describing status or  restrictions for the harvest area.</attrdef> <attrdomv> <edom> <edomv>Approved</edomv> <edomvd>Shellfish Harvest Permitted</edomvd> <edomvds>Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management, Notice of Polluted Shellfishing Grounds</edomvds> </edom> <edom> <edomv>Block Island Seasonal Closure - BI Club</edomv> <edomvd>Effective at sunrise of the last Saturday in June through sunrise of the third Monday in September - all waters of Great Salt Pond, south of a line from the northern most extremity of Cormorant Point to the northern most landward dock located at the Block Island Club, including all waters of Trims Pond and Harbor Pond.</edomvd> <edomvds>Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management, Notice of Polluted Shellfishing Grounds</edomvds> </edom> <edom> <edomv>Block Island Seasonal Closure - Harris Point</edomv> <edomvd>Effective at sunrise of the Saturday immediately prior to Memorial Day through sunrise of the last Saturday in June - the waters of Great Salt Pond south of a line from the northern most extremity of Cormorant Point to the western most extremity of Harris Point including all waters of Trims Pond and Harbor Pond. AND Effective at sunrise of the third Monday in September through sunrise of the Tuesday immediately following Columbus Day - the waters of Great Salt Pond south of a line from the northern most extremity of Cormorant Point to the western most extremity of Harris Point, including all waters of Trims Pond and Harbor Pond.</edomvd> <edomvds>Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management, Notice of Polluted Shellfishing Grounds</edomvds> </edom> <edom> <edomv>Conditional Closure</edomv> <edomvd>Shellfish harvest in these areas may be temporarily restricted as water quality conditions warrant.</edomvd> <edomvds>Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management, Notice of Polluted Shellfishing Grounds</edomvds> </edom> <edom> <edomv>Upper Narragansett Bay Conditional Area - A</edomv> <edomvd>Shellfish harvest in these areas may be temporarily restricted as water quality conditions warrant.</edomvd> <edomvds>Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management, Notice of Polluted Shellfishing Grounds</edomvds> </edom> <edom> <edomv>Upper Narragansett Bay Conditional Area - B</edomv> <edomvd>Shellfish harvest in these areas may be temporarily restricted as water quality conditions warrant.</edomvd> <edomvds>Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management, Notice of Polluted Shellfishing Grounds</edomvds> </edom> <edom> <edomv>Shellfishing Prohibited</edomv> <edomvd>Shellfish harvest in these areas in prohibited</edomvd> <edomvds>Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management, Notice of Polluted Shellfishing Grounds</edomvds> </edom> <edom> <edomv>Not Assessed - Shellfishing Prohibited</edomv> <edomvd>These areas represent numerous small coves, salt marshes, etc, that have not yet been sampled for water quality.  Shellfishing is prohibited as precautionary measure.</edomvd> <edomvds>Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management, Notice of Polluted Shellfishing Grounds</edomvds> </edom> </attrdomv> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>SFCID</attrlabl> <attrdef>Alpha-Numeric code referencing the Shellfish growing area.
